com.poesys.bs.delegate

Class AbstractDaoDelegate<S extends com.poesys.db.dto.IDbDto>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.poesys.bs.delegate.AbstractDaoDelegate<S>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - the database layer DTO type
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractDataDelegate, AbstractReadOnlyDataDelegate

    public abstract class AbstractDaoDelegate<S extends com.poesys.db.dto.IDbDto>
extends java.lang.Object

    An abstract base class that implements the IDataDelegate interface for the JDBC-based business delegates in the application that require a JDBC database connection and DAOs. The abstract class contains the DAO manager and factory and methods that use them.

    Author:
    Robert J. Muller

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractDaoDelegate

        public AbstractDaoDelegate(java.lang.String subsystem,
                           com.poesys.db.connection.IConnectionFactory.DBMS dbms,
                           java.lang.Integer expiration)
        Create a DAO Delegate. This is a standard constructor that sets the name of the subsystem and the database type for construction of connections to the database.
        Parameters:
        subsystem - the name of the subsystem
        dbms - the kind of database that implements the subsystem
        expiration - the cache expiration time in milliseconds for objects this delegate caches in a cache that supports object expiration

      • AbstractDaoDelegate

        public AbstractDaoDelegate(java.lang.String subsystem,
                           java.lang.Integer expiration)
        Create a DAO Delegate. This is a standard JNDI connection constructor that sets up connections by getting the JNDI data source through the subsystem name.
        Parameters:
        subsystem - the JNDI data source subsystem
        expiration - the cache expiration time in milliseconds for objects this delegate caches in a cache that supports object expiration

    • Method Detail

      • getClassName

        protected abstract java.lang.String getClassName()
        Get the fully qualified class name of the IDto concrete subclass that this DAO Delegate manages. It has to be passed in because due to type erasure there is no way to get it from the generic parameter. A subclass that knows the type must implement this method. 
         
 protected String getClassName() {
   return TestNatural.class.getName();
 }
        Returns:
        the class name
